Title: Colombia coal exports plummet after ban on Israel sales
Summary: Colombia's coal exports fell by almost half in July compared to the same month last year . President Gustavo Petro’s ban on sales to Israel . Colombia is Latin America's largest exporter of coal .

Title: Trump offers more US troops to Poland’s nationalist president
Summary: US President Donald Trump offered to send more troops to Poland as he welcomed the country’s new nationalist president Karol Nawrocki to the White House with a military flyover . Trump also hinted at taking stronger action against Russia if Russia does not back down .

Title: 10 lives lost, 10 injured in multiple accidents in Enugu-Port Harcourt Expressway – Police confirm
Summary: Police confirmed that 10 people were killed in two separate fatal accidents along the Ozalla/Four-Corner Enugu axis of the Enugu-Port-Harcourt Expressway . The accidents which occurred on Wednesday also left 10 people with various degrees of injuries .

Title: Jury tells Google to pay $425 mn over app privacy
Summary: Jury orders Google to pay about $425 million for gathering information from smartphone app use even when people opted for privacy settings . Google: "This case is about Google’s illegal interception of consumers’ private information"

Title: Russia says security guarantees sought by Ukraine “danger” to Europe
Summary: Russia says security guarantees sought by Kyiv are “guarantees of danger to Europe’s European continent’ The summit in Paris will be co-chaired by European leaders . Ukraine's president will hold talks with European leaders on such assurances .

Title: Dangote Industries not owner of truck in Enugu crash, say police report
Summary: Police in Enugu State have confirmed that the truck involved in last week’s fatal accident does not belong to Dangote Industries Limited . The truck was involved in a fatal accident along the Enugu–Port Harcourt Expressway . According to a statement, two separate crashes occurred on 3 September 2025 .

Title: Customs collects N3.7 trn in H1
Summary: Nigeria Customs Service generated N3.7 trillion in the first half of the year . Minister of Finance and Coordinating Minister of the Economy, Mr. Wale Edun, disclosed this at the 62nd meeting of the Customs Board .

Title: British International Investment, Babban Gona, sign $7.5m deal to boost food security, others
Summary: British International Investment announces $7.5 million debt investment in Nigerian agri-tech platform, Babban Gona . The deal is to boost food security and climate resilience for smallholder farmers in Northern Nigeria . BIII is UK's development finance institution and impact investor .

Title: PDP presidential ticket: Why I oppose zoning — Olawepo-Hashim
Summary: Dr Gbenga Olawepo-Hashim declared his intention to run for President on the platform of the PDP in 2027 . The former Deputy Publicity Secretary of the Peoples Democratic Party, PDP, said he opposes zoning .

Title: Benue Assembly: Intrigues, plots that ousted Speaker Dajoh
Summary: Governor Hyacinth Alia moved to keep a close eye on the affairs of the Benue State House of Assembly . From the start of his administration, Governor Alia kept a close watch on the situation . The intrigues that unfolded in the past week lend credence to the saying that in politics there are no permanent friends

Title: Israel vows to inflict biblical plagues on Yemen's Huthis rebels
Summary: Israel's defence minister vows to inflict the biblical 10 plagues on Yemen's Huthi rebels . Earlier on Thursday, the Israeli army said a missile fired from Yemen struck outside Israeli territory . The Iran-backed Yemeni rebels have vowed to step up their attacks on Israel after their prime minister and 11 other senior officials were killed in Israeli air

Title: Dangote Group denies ownership of truck in Enugu accident
Summary: Dangote Industries Limited has denied ownership of the truck involved in a fatal accident in Enugu on Wednesday . The truck, bearing the inscription of Visco Investment Global Limited, was travelling from Aba to Abuja when the accident occurred . The company said the vehicle was operated by a third party and tighter measures would be taken to protect

Title: Japa: Libyan employer trapped me, drained my blood - Rescued Nigerian migrant
Summary: Mercy Oluwagbenga, an indigene of Kabba in Kogi State, said she spent four years working in Libya . She said she was confined for months, and nurses repeatedly took her blood so it could be used for her employer’s ailing mother . Mercy said nurses visited monthly to take her

Title: Trump seeks expedited Supreme Court ruling on tariffs
Summary: President Donald Trump’s administration asked the US Supreme Court on Wednesday for an expedited ruling preserving the tariffs that have roiled global markets . The petition comes after a 7-4 ruling by the US Court of Appeals for the Federal Circuit, which found that Trump exceeded his authority in tapping emergency economic powers to impose wide-ranging duties

Title: PHOTOS: Xi, Putin, Kim at Beijing parade as China flaunts military might
Summary: China commemorated the 80th anniversary of Japan’s surrender in World War II with a grand parade on Wednesday . The event showcased an array of cutting-edge weapons, including nuclear, artificial intelligence-powered, laser, and robotic weapons . The parade, dubbed Victory Day, featured over 10,000 troops, hundreds of vehicles,
